metadata.name: Ecalta 100 mg Injection powder for solution

clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For use in the treatment of the following fungal infections Candidemia and other forms of i Candida i infections intra abdominal abscess and peritonitis Aspergillus infections and esophageal candidiasis Also considered an alternative treatment for oropharyngeal canaidiasis

contraindications.disease: During clinical trials a single 400 mg dose of anidulafungin was inadvertently administered as a loading dose No clinical adverse events were reported The maximum non lethal dose of anidulafungin in rats was 50 mg kg a dose which is equivalent to 10 times the recommended daily dose for esophageal candidiasis 50mg day
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Anidulafungin is a semi synthetic lipopeptide synthesized from a fermentation product of i Aspergillus nidulans i Anidulafungin is an echinocandin a class of antifungal drugs that inhibits the synthesis of 1 3 beta D glucan an essential component of fungal cell walls Anidulafungin is active in vitro against many i Candida i as well as some i Aspergillus i Like other echinocandins anidulafungin is not active against i Cryptococcus neoformans i i Trichosporon i i Fusarium i or zygomycetes
